meanings.definition: a type of mechanical ascender used in climbing
meanings.sent1: The climber attached the jumars to the rope to ascend the steep cliff.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her jumars when she goes rock climbing.
meanings.sent3: The jumars looked like tiny robots helping the climber up the mountain.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the jumars that lifted him higher towards his goal.
meanings.sent5: The jumars clicked and clacked as they pulled the climber upwards.

meanings.definition: to ascend using a jumar device
meanings.sent1: He decided to jumars up the rope instead of taking the stairs.
meanings.sent2: They jumarsed quickly to reach the top of the wall.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to jumars effortlessly up the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits began to jumars as she saw the finish line ahead.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon jumarsed gracefully into the sky.

meanings.definition: belonging to or characteristic of the Jumars people
meanings.sent1: The traditional dance showcased the vibrant Jumars culture.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful dress with intricate Jumars patterns.
meanings.sent3: The Jumars cuisine was known for its rich flavors and spices.
meanings.sent4: His artwork was inspired by the colorful Jumars traditions.
meanings.sent5: The Jumars language sounded melodic and unique to outsiders.
